lines.text: Get down off the cross, honey. Somebody needs the wood.

Why even the Declaration of Independence only guaranties life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness. It doesn't say anything about fair. Doesn't even say you have the right to be happy. Just to pursue it.
But no one appreciates me, and I try to be fair, and they don't...
Get down off the cross honey, somebody needs the wood!
Money is made to be spent. What goods it doin' in the bottom of my panty drawer?

[During the seduction scene he drops her bra]
Holy Moley!
Is that all you can say?

[softer and slower]
Holy Moley!
[Giggles]

[Scene cuts to them lying in bed]
Holy Moley!
I'm busier than a one-legged man in a butt-kicking contest

[Arrives with her car keys]
You're the pink Mercedes?
No, I'm Shirlee Kenyon. I drive a pink Mercedes.

Its like you're allergic to cornflakes so you start to buy different stuff like a can of peas but when you open up the can of the peas, inside cornflakes, so you pick a TV dinner and open it up and cornflakes.
So what does that mean?
The girls you go out with... outside all different packages but inside... cornflakes.
I'm returning the car. It came with the job.
Wherever you go you'll need a car.
Nobody needs a 60 thousand dollar car. Besides, I'm not really a Mercedes, I'm just a plain ol' Pontiac... maybe a Chevy.
How's your daughter?
She's back in school and doing really well thanks to you, Dr. Shirlee.
I'm just Shirlee now.
What?
I'm just Shirlee now!
